      Sets the Waka back to the initial state it is to be in when the game first begins and deducts the lives by one

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Continuously checks whether the Waka is colliding with a ghost or wall and calls the method so that the waka is eating fruit objects. If collided with a ghost then all ghost are set back to alive. If no collision then continue moving in the same direction. If a collision is detected then set the x and y speed to 0. If the next move is possible then move in that direction and set the current direction as the next move.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the Waka back to the initial state it is to be in when the game first begins and deducts the lives by one
        Specified by:
        reset in class MoveableObject

      • hasCollided

        public java.lang.String hasCollided(int x,
                                    int y)
        If the Waka has collided with a Wall object the the method will return which direction the collision was in, otherwise will return the string 'no collision'
        Specified by:
        hasCollided in class MoveableObject
        Parameters:
        x, - the horizontal position of the Waka on the map
        y, - the vertical position of the Waka on the map
        Returns:
        if collided: the direction of collision, else: no collision

      • eatFruit

        public void eatFruit()
        Checks whether the Waka has gone past any Fruit objects, if so then it sets the Fruit object attribute 'notEaten' as false, otherwise it does nothing

      • eatSuperFruit

        public void eatSuperFruit()
        Checks whether the Waka has gone past any SuperFruit objects, if so then it sets the SuperFruit object attribute 'notEaten' as false, otherwise it does nothing

      • ghostCollision

        public boolean ghostCollision()
        Checks whether the Waka collides with any ghosts. If it has collided with a Ghost which is frightened, it sets the Ghost attribute 'isAlive' to false and returns false. If it collides with a Ghost which isn't frightened then it will return true. Otherwise returns false
        Returns:
        true if the collision with a non-frightened ghost occurs, otherwise false.
